medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. R's hypertension was first discovered in the early 1990s. There were incidences of very high blood pressure readings, with a history of up to 240/180 mm Hg. He has had difficulty adhering to medication regimens, and at times has ignored recommendations from his physicians. Symptoms included episodes of epistaxis, headaches, and occasional palpitations. Despite feeling good at times, he acknowledged his high blood pressure, referring to it as a 'silent killer.'
medical_history.past_medical_history: Long history of poorly controlled hypertension since the early 1990s; hospitalized for accelerating hypertension in 1994; episodes of epistaxis, headache, and occasional palpitations; adverse effects from multiple antihypertensive medications leading to mental sluggishness, sexual dysfunction, and urinary frequency.
medical_history.family_history: His mother has hypertension, but his siblings do not have reported hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Self-employed businessman, works long and irregular hours, single father of two children (one lives with him), no history of smoking, minimal alcohol use, and intermittent physical activity.
